intro: Genista scariosa, commonly known as the scarious broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces yellow flowers in spring, which are arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. Genista scariosa typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in scrublands and coastal areas. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters.
